text: Keeping in-memory data in sync with a file for long running Python script
I have a Python (2.7) script that acts as a server and it will therefore run for very long periods of time.
This script has a bunch of values to keep track of which can change at any time based on client input.

What I'm ideally after is something that can keep a Python data structure (with values of types dict, list, unicode, int and float – JSON, basically) in memory, letting me update it however I want (except referencing any of the reference type instances more than once) while also keeping this data up-to-date in a human-readable file, so that even if the power plug was pulled, the server could just start up and continue with the same data.

I know I'm basically talking about a database, but the data I'm keeping will be very simple and probably less than 1 kB most of the time, so I'm looking for the simplest solution possible that can provide me with the described data integrity.
Are there any good Python (2.7) libraries that let me do something like this?
